Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the

• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.

ALLEGATION: On 12/27/20, staff member tried to put youth in restraint. Youth
balled up their body in response. Staff member grabbed youth by shirt and dragged
youth outside of the room they were in. Youth did not sustain injuries but has a sore
throat.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Administrator 1 at the facility on 01/08/2021. Administrator 1 stated State
Worker 1 has seen Youth A, but has not interviewed Youth A. Administrator 1 stated
2

Youth A has been in placement at this facility previously for approximately 6 months and
was replaced to this facility in February or March of 2020. Administrator 1 stated there
was no video available of the incident.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 01/08/2021 with State Worker 1. Youth A stated
she was frustrated with the staff regarding a “0” on the facility point system. Youth A
stated she walked around outside and came back into the unit. Youth A said when she
came into the unit she was still upset and tipped over a cubby and started to walk out
again into another peer’s personal aisle. Youth A stated staff approached Youth A and
Youth A curled up into a ball, sitting on the floor with her legs bent, knees up, and arms
wrapped around her legs. Youth A stated Staff 1 grabbed the back of Youth A’s shirt
and scooted/dragged Youth A across the floor 3-5 ft. out of the other peer’s personal
aisle. Youth A said she started shouting and another staff came over and talked Youth
A into calming down. Youth A stated she wasn’t hurt, but she was sent to the doctor the
next morning anyway.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 01/08/2021 with State Worker 1. Staff 1 described
the incident similar to the description reported by Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth A was
redirected numerous times when Youth A was upset about receiving a “0” for an
improper use of Youth A’s mask. Staff 1 stated Staff 4 also tried to de-escalate Youth
A. Staff 1 stated Youth A left the unit and Youth A came back into the unit with Staff 1.
Staff 1 stated that Youth A picked up a chair and threw it, tipped over a cubby, threw
another chair, threw glasses, and started to pull Youth A’s own hair out. Staff 1 stated
they moved toward Youth A and was going to put Youth A in a standing hold, but Youth
A dropped to the floor and curled up in a sitting position. Staff 1 stated she talked to
Youth A and then grabbed the shoulder part of Youth A’s shirt and pulled Youth A out of
the area. Staff 1 said it was a tile floor and she was able to pull/slide Youth A 4-5 ft. to
get out of the area. Staff 1 stated Staff 3 then came and talked to Youth A who calmed
down and Youth A got up on her own and went to her own bunk area. Staff 1 stated
she has worked with Youth A since the incident with no problems. Staff 1 stated she
has not had any other confrontations with Youth A and Staff 1 has tried to minimize her
contact with Youth A. Staff 1 stated she was aware this was not a method consistent
with her restraint training of the facility.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 01/08/2021 with State Worker 1. Staff 2 described
the incident similar to the descriptions reported by Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 2 stated
they were on their way to dinner and Youth A received a “0” for an hour. Staff 2 stated
Youth A was upset, left the unit, and Youth A returned to the unit with Staff 1 and Staff
4. Staff 2 stated when Youth A returned to the unit Youth A threw a chair and ripped
some of her own hair out. Staff 2 stated she blocked Youth A from attempting to exit
again and Staff 1 also attempted to block Youth A from leaving. Staff 2 stated Youth A
then ran to another area and curled up on the floor. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 grabbed the
back of Youth A’s shirt and moved Youth A 3-4 ft. across the tile floor. Staff 2 stated
Youth A didn’t say she was hurt, only that she was choked by the T-Shirt. Staff 2 stated
Youth A eventually got up on her own and went to Youth A’s own area. Staff 2 stated
she did not see any marks or bruises on Youth A following the incident.
3

I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 01/08/2021 with State Worker 1. Youth B was a
peer witness to the incident. Youth B stated Youth A was in Youth B’s personal aisle
and Staff 1 and Staff 2 tried to put Youth A in a standing restraint, but Youth A curled up
on the floor. Youth B stated Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s shirt and pulled Youth A out of
Youth B’s area. Youth B stated Youth A was yelling, but Youth A was not hurt. Youth B
stated she feels safe with Staff 1 and described Staff 1 as good staff.
I participated in a telephone conference on 01/26/2021 with State Worker 1, her
supervisor and Youth A’s probation officer. Youth A’s probation officer reported no
concerns for Youth A. The safety plan that was implemented following this incident was
that Staff 1 would not be alone with Youth A and other staff would dispense medications
for Youth A.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident restraint.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined that Staff 1 did
have inappropriate contact with Youth A by grabbing the shirt of
Youth A and pulling Youth A a short distance across the floor.
Youth A was not injured, but this is not an acceptable or taught
restraint method of this facility. Staff 1 admitted in her interview
that she was aware her actions were inconsistent with her
training.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend with the submission and acceptance of an approved corrective action
plan the current license status of this child care institution-private be maintained.
